issues.subject: builder for fedcatalog generates plus signs when commas are used
issues.description:
When entering multiple stations in the fedcatalog Builder web tool, multiple stations separated by commas create a URL that inserts '+' characters ahead of every subsequent station, causing an incomplete match.  Removing those plus signs, leaving the commas, allows the URL to function as expected.

example:

http://service.iris.edu/irisws/fedcatalog/1/query?sta=CDCB,+BARB,+BAMB&format=request&includeoverlaps=false&nodata=404

issues.subject: Message Center silently deletes HTML-only messages
Send email to network operators
issues.description: asking for DOIs

issues.subject: DOI chokes on (some) Unicode
issues.description:
This description has an invalid character:

>     "description": "The INL Seismic Monitoring Program provides earthquake data and staff expertise in  support of requirements set forth by Presidential executive orders, Department of Energy (DOE) directives, orders and standards, and the Nuclear Regulatory Commission for seismic safety of workers and the public with regard to nuclear related operations at INL. The program supports safety of operations through continuous monitoring of earthquake activity, the development of INL seismic design criteria, assessments of seismic hazards for existing facilities and new facility siting, and early warning of potential future volcanic activity near INL. As of 2019, the INL operates 35 permanent seismic stations with either short period or broadband sensors and 34 accelerometers. Ten accelerometers are located within INL buildings and 13 of the accelerometers are located at free\u001efield sites (i.e., not within buildings) near INL facilities. Eleven accelerometers are collocated with seismic stations located on the Eastern Snake River Plain and in the surrounding Basin and Range region. 17 seismic stations are also continuous GPS sites that transmit data directly to UNAVCO.",

issues.subject: Look into errors
issues.description: There are a lot of errors being generated, largely from fedcatalog and non-IRIS data centers.

issues.subject: Error handler
issues.description:
Wilber shows an error message:

> Failed to get bulk data : Error fetching federator catalog result: 500 :: Internal Server Error

It posts to
http://ds.iris.edu/ds/error_handler/
with
> app: wilber
> message: Failed to get bulk data : Error fetching federator catalog result: 500 :: Internal Server Error

Django manages a model with:

* app
* message
* message_pattern
* description

It finds or creates one for this app/message and returns a link to it:
http://ds.iris.edu/ds/error_handler/72/wilber/Failed+to+get+bulk+data/
which Wilber will show to the user.

@message_pattern@ starts with the text of the message, but can be modified to match a wider range of strings.
@description@ is our documentation of the error

issues.subject: OpenAPI library
issues.description: Functionality is scattered here and there, should be consolidated and better documented

issues.subject: Better discovery of event datasets vs custom query
issues.description:
A common example: on the initial screen (showing the last 30 days) the date picker is used to enter a broader date range.

Some options:

* Eliminate the possibility of selecting a date outside the range, for example eliminate the date picker and show only the slider
* Display a warning if the selected range is outside the dataset
* If the range is outside the dataset, show a link which will put Wilber in custom query mode

Ideally, we should get rid of the distinction between custom query and dataset.  Not sure how to do that, though, apart from ditching the dataset idea entirely.

issues.subject: Station map should indicate selected vs deselected stations
issues.description: Station that's shown but unchecked should be greyed out or something.

issues.subject: WILBER and SY data
issues.description:
1) for example: http://www.iris.edu/wilber3/find_stations/4212443
When selecting channels and I choose a synthetic, say Channel MX?, Wilber is still looking for net.stat=IU.ANMO rather than SY.ANMO.  In the archive, shakemovie synthetics have the network name changed to SY in addition to being uniquely identified with channel MX? or LX?.  Gillian pointed this out to me; sorry I didn't catch it earlier.

1b)
There are 2 sets of shakemovie syntheitcs in the archive, one and three dimensional synthetics.  If you could update it that would be great.
ShakeMovie 1D (LX?)
ShakeMovie 3D (MX?)


2) Small but annoying: 
When on the wilber page, the default is Load Event Data: Past 30 days.  When I go to change the date or Mag, it should automatically change this to Custom Query or you should have an Udate Query button that does this.  It took me a while to figure out that I need to change the Load Event Data to Custom Query, then fiddle with the date/mag.

Thanks.  Assign whatever priority you see fit.
Alex

issues.description:
https://service.iris.edu/irisws/availability/1/query?network=IU&station=ANMO&channel=BHZ&start=2010-02-23T00%3A00%3A00&end=2010-02-23T00%3A00%3A00 <https://service.iris.edu/irisws/availability/1/query?network=IU&station=ANMO&channel=BHZ&start=2010-02-23T00:00:00&end=2010-02-23T00:00:00> 

Station-level availability:
Pick a "known" channel in the station, query will quickly return whether station was availabile.

Put red/green mark on the station with the result. Load automagically via ajax. Automagically deselect from query? (Available as an option? What about user settings anyway?)

Can POST to get batch of stations, ie. prefetch for station record. (At least the DMC stations of it.)

There must be a better way to do this.

issues.description: Because urllib2 sucks!

issues.subject: Paged view of user requests
issues.description:
The initial page can easily be filled up with a single user's queries, making it fairly useless for casual browsing.
At the same time, some of the user pages have gotten really slow because they show all rows.

Both views should be paged.

issues.subject: Changing event data selection should cancel any active Ajax request
issues.description: eg. when page first loads it starts loading the last 30 days.  If this is slow, the user can select a different Event Data set while it is still working.  In that case it should cancel immediately.

issues.subject: Allow request to be modified
issues.description: From the data request page, the user should have the option to modify and rerun the request -- this would only need to include part of the data request dialog, so that the time window and data format can be modified.

issues.subject: Crash on iPad
issues.description: Fairly persistent crash on an original iPad Mini.  It looks like this may be a memory usage issue.

issues.subject: Should be able to bookmark a particular event filter
issues.description: Example: I wanted to send someone a link showing events within a particular geographic area.

issues.subject: ADC1 implementation
issues.description:
Wilber needs to be able to operate from ADC1 independently.  This means:

# Service URLs need to point to ADC1
# Celery processing needs to take place on ADC1
## And thus download links need to be able to point to ADC1

Since both sites share the same database, the Seattle/ADC1 distinction probably needs to be in the data.  This does have the advantage that we can show both Seattle and ADC1 requests in the same view.

issues.subject: Provide service for and emmbed the user-specified keywords in the DS data products pages
issues.description:
The DMC's data product pages have a curated set of keywords in the form of Django tags.  For example on http://ds.iris.edu/ds/products/emtf there are 9 keywords in the "Tags" section of the page.

The goal is to expose these keywords further while leveraging the single location to maintain them.  Two ideas regarding that are:

1) provide an internal service that can be used by SPUD to fetch the keywords for a given data product page, i.e. the "Tags" that show up on a products landing page.  SPUD can then look those up and embedded them as <meta name="keywords" content="<TAGS>" /> in its product pages.

2) The Django pages themselves could embed the Tags for those pages as <meta name="keywords" content="<TAGS>" />

Other ideas welcome.

issues.subject: FDSN website search broken
issues.description: The search feature in the FDSN website is broken. It appears that it is using an unsupported version of Google's Custom Search Element API.

issues.subject: Message center threads have no size restriction on attachments

issues.subject: message-center-owner email address on rejection

issues.subject: Look into db replication/failover
issues.description:
2 issues/questions:

# has-and-belongs-to-many relationships involve a join table with no PK, which can't be replicated. Workaround?
# If we do fail over we presumably need to run in read-only mode, is this possible?

issues.subject: Maintenance mode / database failover
issues.description:
The 12/19 database upgrade illustrated some problems with our current maintenance mode approach.

One idea would be:

# Django catches a database outage
# Django fails over to a backup (presumably read-only) database
# Django detects when the main database is back up, and switches back

For all of these, the "how" requires investigation.

We might be able to get Nagios to notify Django when the database goes out and comes back, one issue might be that it might take 5 minutes to notice. (Fine for detecting the recovery, but too long for detecting the outage.)

issues.subject: Process for changing a network code
issues.description: This is outside normal operations but it does happen, so there should be a path for this.

issues.subject: BREQ_FAST form shows restricted data as being available
issues.description:
If given a query that would return restricted data, the form shows a green "D" status indicator.

Assuming this uses the fdsnws-station service to get this information, we can't directly tell whether data is restricted or not.

One option might be that unless the "Include restricted" checkbox is marked, this availability query uses @includerestricted=false@. That would result in the data appearing to be unavailable. If we do this, we should rerun the query any time the user changes the "Include restricted" input.

issues.subject: Fix duplicated file uploads
issues.description:
When uploading files to the admin pages, if something goes wrong the file can be put in the system but not in the database. When the user tries again, the filename already exists so the new upload is given a different filename. This can result in a bunch of copies of a file, and the "live" one has junk characters in it. Example: 
1. Azer2017_ppt_En_Last.pptx
1. Azer2017_ppt_En_Last_0XZsP6i.pptx
1. Azer2017_ppt_En_Last_2aJFGIZ.pptx
1. Azer2017_ppt_En_Last_70Iosak.pptx
1. Azer2017_ppt_En_Last_HxhisXi.pptx
1. Azer2017_ppt_En_Last_O3YJYkw.pptx
1. Azer2017_ppt_En_Last_SF8WGW8.pptx
1. Azer2017_ppt_En_Last_kXyQ1cF.pptx
1. Azer2017_ppt_En_Last_rBLLHYW.pptx
1. Azer2017_ppt_En_Last_vDAqw9F.pptx
The one in the database (and thus presented to the user) is @Azer2017_ppt_En_Last_vDAqw9F.pptx@. There should be a management command that finds these, removes the duplicates, and ensures that the original filename is the one used in the database.

issues.subject: Builder changes for http://service.iris.edu/mustangbeta/noise-mode-timeseries/1/
issues.description:
> Begin forwarded message:
> 
> From: Bruce Weertman <bruce@iris.washington.edu>
> Subject: Builder changes for http://service.iris.edu/mustangbeta/noise-mode-timeseries/1/
> Date: June 19, 2017 at 10:33:50 AM PDT
> To: IRIS <adam@iris.washington.edu>
> 
> Adam:
> 
> I’ve added some new functionality to the noise-mode-timeseries web-service.
> 
> (1) output=<power|powerdhnm|powerdlnm|powerdnm>
> (2) noisemodel.byperiod=<pipe-separated-list>
> (3) noisemodel.byfrequency=<pipe-separated-list>
> 
> Take a look at: 
> 
> http://service.iris.edu/mustangbeta/noise-mode-timeseries/docs/1/help/#noisemodel
> 
> noisemodel.byperiod & noisemodel.byfrequency are mutually exclusive. 
> 
> They only have an effect if output=powerdhnm|powerdlnm|powerdnm are specified
> 
> output=power is the default and is the same as what is in production now. 
> 
> (4) New way to make frequency/period selection
> 
> This isn’t a new parameter, just a new way that parameters can be used
> 
> http://service.iris.edu/mustangbeta/noise-mode-timeseries/docs/1/help/#frequencyselection
> 
> See "Selection by Range"
> 
> The builder seems to work ok with this now as it is. 
> Example. In the builder, changing
> “Frequency Options” to “frequencies” and then changing “0.1,0.01” to “[0.1,0.01]” works
> 
> So I’m not sure if you need to change that or not. Seems like probably not.
> 
> -B
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
>

issues.subject: Textile errors
issues.description: Upgrading from 2.2.2 to 2.3.3 seems to have caused a number of pages to error out.

* Shortcourse registration form: http://ds.iris.edu/ds/short-courses/2016/12/iris-data-services-short-course-agu/register/

issues.subject: User information email
issues.description:
It would be really handy to be able to send a user an email summarizing their information and including a link to get into the site. eg. 
This is your user information at ds.iris.edu.

Name: Adam Clark
Email: adam@iris.washington.edu

You are currently subscribed to these mailing lists:
- AGU Meetings (link)
- EGU Meetings (link)
- Jobs (link)

Your account can currently be accessed using:
- A password
- Your Google account (adam@iris.washington.edu)
or if they don't have a password/social login: 
You can access your account with this time-sensitive URL:
(link)
This URL will expire in 7 days.
I see this being used for: * Occasional batch reminders (really we could use this right now, after a relatively messy transition from the old mailing lists) * On request by the user (this might replace the password reset feature) * New users who sign up by email or some other non-web method

issues.subject: Textile utility for responsive tables
issues.description:
It would be nice to have a function that will scan a block of content for tags and wrap each table in 
/div>
Otherwise a scroll bar is added around an entire block of content. One particularly bad case is the scroll bar around the web service query argument tables. (eg. https://service.iris.edu/fdsnws/station/1/)

issues.subject: Web Team Manager Duties
issues.description: Work related to managing the web team

issues.subject: Webmaster Duties
issues.description: Tracking issue for miscellaneous webmaster duties

issues.subject: Moderator remove message from thread
issues.description: We've had a few cases where a user posts a message by replying to an earlier message, but it's not intended as a reply. (Presumably they used "reply" just to get the email address of the list.) For these cases, it would be useful for the moderator to be able to remove the message from the earlier thread before approving it. This should create a new thread in Django, and clear out the @In-Reply-To@ and @References@ headers in the email.

issues.subject: Incoming message defaults
issues.description: New issues received by email should be assigned to the sender by default.

issues.subject: Make message center more tag-like
issues.description:
For instance, the footer. Shouldn't just copy listservs, it's not a listserv. 

This message posted to MC, under:
topic [topic ...]
IRIS MC etc

Subtle maybe, but should really look like a tag list rather than a list of lists. 

Also, should give immediate feedback about selecting a topic (channel?) that would be moderated. 

Wonder if this could be open sourced? Presumably others have this particular need. Would need some cleanup.

issues.subject: Topic link from thread
issues.description: Topic page is by month, so link from thread should go to the (a?) month the thread is in.

issues.subject: DS website slowness
issues.description: I'm seeing slow responses in general. According new NewRelic, the issue was in Postgres, but I wasn't able to verify this, and there was some indication that NewRelic itself might be the issue. But NewRelic is now disabled and the response still seems fairly slow.

issues.subject: Error on DS short course page at ADC1
issues.description:
This URL works at the DMC but not at ADC1, I'm guessing there's a discrepancy in the installed library versions.
http://ds.iris.edu/ds/short-courses/2016/12/iris-data-services-short-course-agu/register/ <http://ds.iris.edu/ds/short-courses/2016/12/iris-data-services-short-course-agu/register/>

issues.subject: Software section should support GItHub-housed projects
issues.description:
Example:
http://ds.iris.edu/ds/nodes/dmc/software/downloads/libmseed/
https://github.com/iris-edu/libmseed

Here are some potentially useful GitHub API URLs:
https://api.github.com/repos/iris-edu/libmseed
https://api.github.com/repos/iris-edu/libmseed/tags
https://api.github.com/repos/iris-edu/libmseed/contents/README.md

issues.subject: Look into duplicated accounts
issues.description:
For example:

* Kevin.Buckley@ecs.vuw.ac.nz
* kevin.buckley@mcs.vuw.ac.nz

These are obviously the same person, but two different accounts. Are there more easily-identifiable duplicates? Maybe we can have a process to easily allow these accounts to be merged.

issues.subject: Map popup in responsive UI
issues.description: The map may be wider than the screen, rendering some controls inaccessible, and in that case the popup itself is positioned oddly (it looks like the left edge of the popup is in the middle of the screen).

issues.subject: In user-level moderation, if a message was crossposted it can appear multiple times
issues.description: Presumably only if the user is moderator of multiple topics

issues.subject: Reorganize signup/login pages
issues.description:
Right now we have a bunch of login/signup pages:

* http://ds.iris.edu/account/login/ is the main login page
* http://ds.iris.edu/account/signup/ is linked from the login page, it is just for users to create a new email-based account
* http://ds.iris.edu/account/onboard/ is an "onboarding" page, it's basically the signup page but also includes the social account options
* http://ds.iris.edu/account/password/reset/ is mostly the same as the signup page

Technically, there are 3 ways of getting into the site, and they are all functionally identical:

# Social account
# Email verification
# Password

The password option is only usable for signing into an existing account, simply because the user has to have logged in earlier to set the password. Otherwise, internally there's no distinction between "sign up" and "sign in". (eg. you can sign into an existing account using email verification)

The mishmash of pages should really be reorganized to better reflect the actual authentication process.

issues.subject: Tool to generate request from event/channel data
issues.description:
Really just for time windowing? eg. /request?net=IU&event_lat=65.4&event_lon=123.3&event_depth=30&event_time=2015-03-04T03:22:00 
IU ANMO * * 2015-03-04T03:25:00 2015-03-04T03:27:00
IU BKND * * 2015-03-04T03:25:00 2015-03-04T03:27:00
...

issues.subject: Changes for new event service
issues.description: There are a few minor changes in the event service that should be reflected in other tools.

issues.subject: ADC1 failover doesn't work for DS site
Site navigation / organization
issues.description: The site remains confusing and difficult to navigate.

issues.subject: Bounce handling
issues.description: Emails that consistently produce bounces should be identified and possibly removed automatically.

issues.subject: Celery errors aren't emailed to admins
issues.description: The Django logger will email admins on any error-level message, but this doesn't work from Celery.

issues.subject: Issues with PASSCAL network notifications
issues.description:
These are pasted from the email into a textarea field by Gale. The problem is that they aren't strictly structured, so parsing currently requires various heuristics which are liable to be broken by trivial changes on the PIC side.

Emailing with David Thomas to work out a better system.

issues.subject: Clean up old pages
issues.description:
There are a number of pages from the old (pre-Django) site that are still accessible. These need to be evaluated and removed or migrated to Django.

I created a wiki pages for tracking these: [[Static pages still to be migrated]]

issues.subject: Investigate Vue
issues.description:
http://vuejs.org/

This is a fairly lightweight React-like Javascript library, I think it could be a very useful framework for our client-side functionality.
